skill.name: surveillance-monitoring
skill.description: Monitor Ubiquiti Protect surveillance cameras and events. Track camera status, review recordings and alerts, and monitor system health.
skill.summary: Monitor Ubiquiti Protect surveillance cameras and events. Track camera status, review recordings and...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 20 potential issues. Evaluation determined all findings are false positives: backticks in markdown are code formatting, not command execution. JSON line references for 'weak crypto' are metadata fields. Skill is legitimate Ubiquiti Protect camera monitoring tool.

content.value_statement: Managing a Ubiquiti Protect surveillance system requires checking multiple cameras, events, and system health metrics across different interfaces. This skill provides unified access to camera status, event logs, and system diagnostics for efficient surveillance management.
actual_capabilities: List all cameras with their connectivity and status
Retrieve and filter surveillance events by type and time
Monitor Protect system health including storage usage
Get network device information for cameras
limitations: Cannot control camera PTZ or settings

use_cases.title: Daily Security Review
use_cases.description: Check all cameras are online and review overnight motion events to verify nothing was missed during inactive hours.

use_cases.title: System Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Monitor storage capacity, system load, and camera connectivity to prevent failures before they impact surveillance coverage.

use_cases.title: Coverage Audit
use_cases.description: Verify camera placement covers all critical areas and identify gaps that may require additional camera deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Camera Status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all cameras in the Protect system and their current status.
prompt_templates.scenario: Get a quick overview of all cameras

prompt_templates.title: Recent Events Check
prompt_templates.prompt: What surveillance events occurred in the last 24 hours? Show me motion detection and person detection events.

prompt_templates.title: System Health Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the Protect system health including storage usage, total cameras, and any offline devices.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: List all cameras with their network status. Identify any offline cameras and areas that may need additional coverage.

output_examples.input: Show all cameras and their status
output: System Status: 3 of 4 cameras online, 1 offline
- 06:15 AM: Motion detected - Front Door (5 events)
- 11:30 PM: Smart detection zones activated - Backyard
Total: 47 events today, 3 with person detection

best_practices: Check camera status daily to catch connectivity issues early
Review event logs weekly to identify patterns and potential security concerns
Monitor storage usage proactively to prevent recording gaps
anti_patterns: Do not use for real-time incident response requiring immediate video access
Do not rely on this skill for accessing live camera streams
Do not use for PTZ control or camera configuration changes

faq.question: What cameras are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with all cameras supported by Ubiquiti Protect including G4, G5, and other UniFi camera models.

faq.question: Can I view live video?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides status information, event logs, and system health data. Live video viewing requires the Protect app or controller interface.

faq.question: How far back can I query events?
faq.answer: Event retrieval depends on your Protect retention settings. The skill can query events within your configured retention period.

faq.question: Can I export video clips?
faq.answer: No, this skill cannot export video. It provides metadata about events that can help you locate recordings in the Protect interface.

faq.question: Does this work with UniFiOS?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with UniFiOS-based systems including UniFi Dream Machines, UniFi Cloud Keys, and UniFi Consoles.

faq.question: How often should I check camera status?
faq.answer: Daily status checks are recommended for active surveillance systems. Critical infrastructure may benefit from hourly automated checks.
